intro: Adnaria lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed adnaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal areas. Adnaria lanceolata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
